alert.note: Alert for Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 2:48PM EST until February 21 at 12:17AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Cumberland River at Williamsburg affecting Whitley County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cumberland River at Williamsburg. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM EST Saturday the stage was 26.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:00 PM EST Saturday was 26.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.3 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage Monday evening. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.1 feet on 03/25/1993. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. The next statement will be issued by 9 PM EST Saturday.
